page.title: 09THE SHORELINE OF ARNE
page.content: Along the shoreline there is shallow brackish water, 0_1.5m in depth, as in all parts of Poole Harbour.Zostera or Eelgrass grows in the warm shallow water and provides food for innumerable invertebrates which in turn feed on birds and fish.These undisturbed shallow waters and mudflats are very important feeding grounds for both resident waders and winter migrants.Despite the RSPB bird reserve ,nearby wildfowling is a traditional sport of the area. Along the North-West coast of Arne is the deeper Wareham channel which has to be dredged regularly to enable small boats and cruisers to reach Wareham_the head of navigation in Roman times.Cormorant,Heron,Mallard, Shelduck,Oystercatcher,Curlew,Redshank Great black-backed gull are common species to be found here.
